page.title: 18VILLAGE LIFE IN TRETHURGY
page.content:
With few exceptions, the majority of villagers are the first generation to live in Trethurgy. To them village life offers the advantages of peace, privacy, freedom and cheap housing.
Disadvantages include the lack of amenities, this especially affects the youth. There is a village institute, but this caters mainly for the older generation, with the main event being the annual Fruit and Vegetable Show.
Most people depend on China Clay, either directly or indirectly as a source of income. There are a number of small holdings, with three family- run beef farms, of about 25-50 acres, but these do not bring in enough money and the owners have to work elsewhere to supplement their income.
